openconnector

Class ConnectorConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.ConnectorConfig

  • public class ConnectorConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    A ConnectorConfig contains information about how a connector should connect to a resource, how the connector should behave, and how objects will look on a resource.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • CONFIG_DELTA_AGGREGATION

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_DELTA_AGGREGATION
        A Reseerved ConnectorConfig parameter name that is passed in to indicate that delta aggregation is to be performed.

        On the IIQ side, this is passed in the options Map to the iterate() method, here since we merge the Application config attributes and the options into a single ConnectorConfig we have to be careful about name collisions. On the IIQ side this name is also used for delta agg state.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_DELTA_AGGREGATION_STATE

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_DELTA_AGGREGATION_STATE
        A Reseerved ConnectorConfig parameter name that is used to save state related to delta aggregation. The value must be a Map and the Connector may store any XML serializable objects in this map. The Map may be updated either during iteration or when Connector.close is called. The contents of this Map will be persisted by the host, and passed in the ConnectorConfig on the next call to this Connector.

        This is functionally equivalent to the IIQ side attribute Application.ATTR_DELTA_AGGREGATION but we have to use a different name since configuration attributes and options are merged here and "deltaAggregation" is used to indiciate the desire for delta agg.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getTypedAttribute

        public java.lang.String getTypedAttribute(java.lang.String attributeName,
                                 java.lang.String objectType)
        Returns:
        the string value of an attribute from the config for the given object type (if specified). This first looks for an attribute with "objectType.attributeName" as the key. If no value is found, this looks for an attribute with "attributeName" as the key.
